page.title: 01MIDDLE IRVINE VALLEY
page.content: Newmilns is a small town with a population of circa 4,000. Industries are mainly light and are diversed, the two main ones being the manufacture of lace and crucibles for the steel industries etc. Surrounding land is mainly grassland used for dairy cattle, although crops and sheep grazing take place to a much lesser scale. Although the industries are thriving, they do not support all of the population and many people commute to work in Kilmarnock and other large Ayrshire towns, making Mewmilns a semi-dormitory town. There are all the usual types of shops and services for such a town but there are no chain-shops. Newmilns is cloisely linked with the other valley towns, Galston, Darvel and Hurlford and the communities are very much interlinked, with a common secondary school at
